page.title: 15CONSERVATION OF WILDLIFE
page.content: Whilst modern agricultural methods have drastically altered the environment, an abundance of natural flora and fauna are still to be found in the hedgerows, woods and along the banks of the River Leadon. To encourage the enjoyment of the countryside and conservation, Hartpury Parish Council have produced a booklet called "Walking around Hartpury" which describes all the parish footpaths, many of which have been cleared,and signs and stiles erected.To replace the elms destroyed by disease, a variety of coniferous and deciduous trees, mainly oaks, have been planted in Hartpury,especially on land belonging to Corsend Farm.In 1984 Catsbury Wood was completely cleared and replanted with oak, sweet chestnut and alder.
